REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.birthday_per_week(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The birthday_per_week function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user’s information to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBase: Pass in the contact details

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(id_: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶
The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.
Args:

id_ (int): The ID of the contact to be retrieved. user (User): The user who is requesting this information. db (Session): A connection to the database, which will be used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • user – User: Get the user who is making the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact. db (Session): A session object for interacting with our database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Identify the user who is making the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The removed contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contact(user: User, db: Session, name: str = None, last_name: str = None, email: str = None) → List[ContactResponse]¶

The search_contact function searches for contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • name – str: Search for a contact by name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

Returns:

A list of contactresponse objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(id_: int, body: ContactBase, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

id_ (int): The ID of the contact to update. body (ContactBase): The updated information for the contact. user (User): The current user, used to check if they are authorized to update this contact. db (Session): A connection with an open transaction, used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • id – int: Get the id of the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactBase: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user information from the token

  • db – Session: Interact with the database

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function sets the confirmed field of a user to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email address of the user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object containing the data to be inserted into the database. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy Session object used to interact with the database.

Returns:

User: A User object representing a row in our users table.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user we want to get

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

The first user with the given email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Args:

email (str): The email address of the user to update. url (str): The URL for the new avatar image. db (Session, optional): A database session object to use instead of creating one locally. Defaults to None. # noQA: E501 line too long

Parameters:

  • email – Identify the user and the url parameter is used to update the avatar

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that we want to update

  • token – str | None: Specify the type of the token parameter

  • db – Session: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.
The function takes in a ContactBase object, which is defined as follows:
class ContactBase(ContactInDB):

id: int name: str email_address: str = None

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBase: Get the contact details from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

:param : Get the current user from the database :return: The contact object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete. db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session. Defaults to Depends(get_db). current_user (User, optional): User object for currently logged in user. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that will be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id :return: The deleted contact :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthday(interval: int = 7, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_birthday function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • interval – int: Specify the number of days from today to search for birthdays

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user id from the token

:param : Define the number of days in which we want to get birthdays :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user from the database

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contact object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.list_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), first_name: str = None, last_name: str = None, email: str = None, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user)) → list[ContactResponse] | ContactResponse¶

The list_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Get the database connection

  • first_name – str: Filter contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the current user :return: A list of contactresponse objects, but the get_contact function returns a single contactresponse object :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactBase, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A ContactBase object containing the new values for the contact.

  • contact_id: An integer representing the id of an existing contact to be updated.

  • db (optional): A Session object used to connect to and query a database, defaults to None if not provided by caller.

    If no db is provided, one will be created using get_db().

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBase: Receive the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the user id of the logged in user

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A contactbase object :doc-author: Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function returns the current user’s information.

— get:

tags: [users] # This is a tag that can be used to group operations by resources or any other qualifier. summary: Returns the current user’s information. description: Returns the current user’s information based on their JWT token in their request header. responses: # The possible responses this operation can return, along with descriptions and examples of each response type (if applicable).

&quot;200&quot;: # HTTP status code 200 indicates success! In this case, it means we successfully returned a User

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user object

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

file (UploadFile): The image to be uploaded. current_user (User): The user whose avatar is being updated. db (Session): A database session object for interacting with the database.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Get the current user and the parameter is used to get a database session :return: The user object :doc-author: Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we raise an HTTPException with a status code of 400 (Bad Request) and detail message &quot;Verification error&quot;.

If they do exist in our database but their confirmed field is already True (meaning their email has already been confirmed), then we return a JSON response with message &quot;Your email is already confirmed&quot;. Otherwise, we call

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The following:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Check if the user is authenticated or not :return: A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link to confirm their account. The function takes in the body of the request, which is a RequestEmail object containing only one field: email. It also takes in the background_tasks object, which is used for sending emails asynchronously. The request parameter contains information about the HTTP request that was made, and db is a database session that can be used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add tasks to the background task queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Get the user’s email address from the database :return: A message to the user :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Send the email to the user :return: A dictionary :doc-author: Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A string that is the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to datetime.utcnow() and exp (expiration time) is set to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a token

Returns:

A token in the form of a byte string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. This should include at least a username and an email address, but can also include other information such as roles or permissions. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until this token expires, defaults to 7 days if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiry time of the refresh token

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function will raise an HTTPException if the token is invalid or has expired. If the token is valid, it will return a string with the email address of user who owns that refresh_token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that was sent to the client

Returns:

A string which is the email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object if it’s valid, otherwise raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to retrieve the email address from within it.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user who requested the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with the plain text password entered by user

Returns:

True if the password is correct, and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for each account. -username: the username of the account that was just created. This is displayed in

confirmation message sent to them via email.

-host: this is used as part of URL that will be sent out in order for users to confirm their

accounts.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
